Article: TITLE: Abdominal pain as an initial symptom of isolated ACTH deficiency induced by nivolumab in a patient with malignant mesothelioma. ABSTRACT: Used for a wide range of cancers, nivolumab has been reported to cause immune-related adverse events, including isolated adrenocorticotropic hormone deficiency (IAD). We report an 81-year-old woman with malignant mesothelioma who presented with abdominal pain after eight courses of nivolumab therapy, leading to the diagnosis of nivolumab-induced IAD. Infusion-resistant hypotension and hyponatraemia can further suggest AI. The symptoms of IAD, such as general fatigue, anorexia, weight loss and nausea, are non-specific, which may delay diagnosis.8 Here, we report nivolumab-induced IAD in a patient with malignant mesothelioma who had abdominal pain as an initial symptom.
